Description: Terracotta cooking stove fragment. A pot-support: a theatre mask of Seilenos, with pointed ears, his beard damaged and the actual support lost; it is set within a rectangular panel. The back is plain, and no trace of the fire-bowl to which it was attached survives. Pressed into a one-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt with a grey-brown core. White coating, perhaps a preparation for painting.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.09)
